title: What are the best Queensrÿche songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Like most good Progressive groups, they have one song on almost every album that is complete trash. The Warning - N M 156Rage For Order - Gonna Get Close To YouOperation Mindcrime - nothing. This whole album is greatEmpire - ResistancePromised Land - My Global MindHear in the Now Frontier - every song except Sp00lQ2K - every song except The Right Side of My MindTribe - every songOperation Mindcrime II - every song except The ChaseTake Cover - doesn’t count. all covers.American Soldier - Hundred Mile StareDedicated to Chaos - Got It BadFrequency Unknown - doesn’t count, but this whole album is horrible anywayQueensrÿche - nothing. This whole album is great  But to answer the question and list some of the greatest IMHO: Queensrÿche (EP) - The Lady Wore BlackThe Warning - Deliverance, No Sanctuary, Roads to MadnessRage For Order - Walk in the Shadows, Neue RegelOperation Mindcrime - Suite Sister Mary, Eyes of a StrangerEmpire - Empire, Silent Lucidity, Anybody ListeningPromised Land - I Am I, Bridge, Real WorldHear in the Now Frontier - sp00lQ2K - The Right Side of My MindTribe - nothingOperation Mindcrime II - The ChaseTake Cover - doesn’t count. all covers.American Soldier - Home AgainDedicated to Chaos - Around the WorldFrequency Unknown - doesn’t count, but this whole album is horrible anywayQueensrÿche - In This Light, A World Without

My personal favorite QR song is Take Hold of the Flame off of their first album The Warning. Operation Mindcrime is a concept album that is amazing start to finish. It is well worth the listen but take that one on when you have an hour to kill. It is way better when absorbed as a whole concept. Rage for Order has some great songs like Walk in the Shadows and Screaming in Digital. Empire is another great album with some really string material. Their latest self titled album is really well done and harken back to their original sound. Their new vocalist Todd La Torre has the chops that Geoff Tate used to have without sounding just like him. There are several albums in between Empire and Queensryche that have a song or two that work but overall I don't care for them.
